handbook-burdenbasket-obtain: Place one very thin branch (vertically) on on the ground to begin the basket (RMB). Add cordage to the frame (Sneak + RMB). Add (4) very thin branches to complete the bag frame (Sneak + RMB). Add a large sisal rug to complete the item (Sneak + RMB). To collect the item, break with an empty hand or any tool. When collected, the burden basket will be placed in the first available inventory container slot.
Place a very thin barked branch on the g: Place one very thin barked branch on a solid surface to begin the backpack. Add leather strips (Sneak+RMB). Add 4 of the same very thin barked branches to make the structure. Add 4 hides (Sneak + RMB) to finish the Backpack.

Place one very thin barked branch on a solid surface. Add reeds (Sneak + RMB) and then 4 of the same very thin barked branches to make the structure. Finish by adding 4 reeds (Sneak + RMB) to make the Basket.
Place a Bamboo panel on the ground and (: All panels must be the same bamboo type to craft this block. Place one bamboo panel on a solid surface (RMB). Add four very thin branches (of any type) to create the frame for the sides (Sneak + RMB). Add four bamboo panels to construct the sides (Sneak + RMB). Add two leather strips to prepare the container for the top (Sneak + RMB). Add one bamboo panel to construct the lid (Sneak + RMB). Add a label using a small sisal rug (Sneak + RMB). Break with any tool and replace to use the container.
Place a Barked Thin Branch vertically on: Place a Barked Thin Branch vertically down on the ground, shift right click with any cordage, then shift right click again with 3 more Bark Thin Branches.
Place a Barked very Thin Branch horizont: Place a Barked Very Thin Branch horizontally , shift right click with any cordage, then shift right click again with 3 more Barked Very Thin Branches.
Place a Debarked Very Thin Branch vertic: Place one barked very thin branch on a solid surface to begin the frame (RMB). Add any cordage: sisal twine, sinew, leather strips (Sneak + RMB) and finish the block by adding one additional very thin branch of any wood type. Break the block using an empty hand or any tool to collect.
itemdesc-carnivoremeat-cooked: Eat only in emergency. This meat will give satiation, but is bad for your health!
itemdesc-bowlimb-carved: Carved limb made with a knife and stick. Combine with bowstring to craft the carved bow.
itemdesc-bowlimb-composite: Made by combining a carved limb, with glue, horn slab, and sinew. Combine with bowstring to craft the composite bow.
itemdesc-bowlimb-recurve: Made by combining a composite limb with glue, horn slab, sinew, and hide. Combine with bowstring to craft the recurve bow.
itemdesc-animal-leatherstrips: Used as cordage in immersive crafting
itemdesc-animal-tendon: Use any knife to create Sinew (grid)
itemdesc-intestines: Use in immersion cooking with large mixing bowl and knife to create casings
itemdesc-casings: Use in immersion cooking to package foods, created from intestines using a large bowl and knife.
itemdesc-byproducts-sinew: Used as cordage in immersive crafting, Used to craft Sinew fibers and bowlimbs.
itemdesc-byproducts-sinew-fibers: Place any hammer above Sinew (grid). Used to craft Glue and Sinew Thread (grid).
itemdesc-byproducts-sinew-thread: Place 3 Sinew Fibers in a horizontal row (grid). Used to craft Sinew Rope and Bowstring. (Future uses: sewing thread, fishing line)
itemdesc-byproducts-rope: Crafted from 6 Sinew threads (Grid, 2 columns of 3). Currently no use. (Future Use: lasso.)
itemdesc-byproducts-lasso: Assemble a 2 x 2 Square of Sinew Thread in the top right corner and 1 on the left bottom of the grid.
itemdesc-byproducts-bowstring: Crafted from 2 Sinew and 3 Sinew thread (grid). Combine with crafted limbs to make immersion bows: carved, composite, and recurve. Replace the bowstring on immersion bows to repair the weapon.
itemdesc-animal-horn: Use any knife to craft horn slabs (grid). (Future Use: tool handles and trade goods.)
itemdesc-byproduct-bowlfiber: Place 6 sinew fibers above a bowl in the grid. Used to make glue in a fire pit.
itemdesc-byproducts-glue: Crafted by cooking a bowl of Sinew Fibers. Used for crafting composite and recurve bowlimbs. (Future uses of glue include other tool assembly.)
itemdesc-byproducts-hornslab: Use any knife above the horn to carve horn slabs (grid). Used to craft composite and recurve bowlimbs. (Future use: tool handles and trade goods.)
itemdesc-fletching-*: Not yet implemented.  A knife with feather, bamboo or vine will create fletching. Future: add immersion and alternate materials.
itemdesc-sisal-fibers: Crafted by crushing sisal leaves. Place 3 in a row to craft Sisal Thread (grid).
itemdesc-sisal-thread: Crafted from sisal fiber. Arrange in a 2 X 2 square to craft Sisal Twine (grid).
itemdesc-sisal-twine: Used as cordage in immersive crafting. Can substitute for flax twine in some vanilla grid recipes. Used to make Sisal Rope, Sisal Rugs
itemdesc-sisal-rope: Crafted from 6 sisal twine. Used to craft wooden buckets.
blockdesc-tropicalfruits-bananna: Cannot be used in cooking, but can be eaten raw.
blockdesc-tropicalfruits-coconutshell-*: Place on a solid surface and use a knife (Sneak + RMB) to remove the husk.
blockdesc-tropicalfruits-coconut-*: Place on a solid surface and use and axe (Sneak + RMB) to cut into slices.
blockdesc-tropicalfruits-coconutbroken-*: A pile of Coconut Slices, use RMB with an empty hand or any tool to collect.
blockdesc-tropicalfruits-coconutslice-*: Cannot be used in cooking, but can be eaten raw.
itemdesc-animal-small-bones: Grind into bonemeal using a quern
blockdesc-adobe: Immersion addition, a primitive building material crafted from clay and sand.
blockdesc-cob: Immersion addition, a primitive building material crafted from clay, grass, and soil on a wicker fence frame.
blockdesc-mudwall-east: Immersion addition, a primitive building material
blockdesc-fence-wicker: Immersion addition, a simple fence crafted from sticks.
blockdesc-gate-gap: Immersion addition, a fence gap crafted from sticks.
blockdesc-base: Immersion addition. Used as a base for both industrial and railroad posts
blockdesc-post-industrial-*: Immersion addition. Place on a post base to create a lamppost. Mounts can be added to suspend lanterns.
blockdesc-post-railroad-*: Immersion addition. Place on a post base to create a lamppost. Mounts can be added to suspend lanterns.
blockdesc-attachment-industrial-*: Immersion addition. Place on a solid block or post to attach a lantern
blockdesc-attachment-railroad-*: Immersion addition. Place on a solid block or post to attach a lantern
block-branch-cordage-acacia-bark-*: Acacia Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-birch-bark-*: Birch Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-oak-bark-*: Oak Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-pine-bark-*: Pine Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-kapok-bark-*: Kapok Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-maple-bark-*: Maple Barked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-acacia-debarked-*: Acacia Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-birch-debarked-*: Birch Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-oak-debarked-*: Oak Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-pine-debarked-*: Pine Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-kapok-debarked-*: Kapok Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
block-branch-cordage-maple-debarked-*: Maple Debarked Very Thin Branch with Cordage
blockdesc-branch-cordage-*-bark-leathers: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 Very Thin Branches of the same type to make a Bag Assembly
blockdesc-branch-cordage-*-bark-sisal: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 Very Thin Branches (of the same type) to make a Bag Assembly
blockdesc-branch-cordage-*-bark-reeds: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 Very Thin Branches (of the same type) to make a Basket Frame
blockdesc-basket-frame-*: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 Reeds to make a Basket
blockdesc-bag-assembly-*-bark-leatherstr: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 hides to make a Backpack
blockdesc-bag-assembly-*-bark-sisal: (Sneak + RMB) with a Large Sisal Rug to make a Burden Basket
blockdesc-burdenbasket: Immersion portable storage, provides 10 inventory slots when equipped.
blockdesc-scaffolding: Use these blocks as portable ladders. Climb up the blocks (Sneak + RMB, as a ladder), break the blocks to descend safely.
blockdesc-drying-rack-assemble-*: (Sneak + RMB) with Reeds, Sinew, Leather Strips, or Sisal Twine to finish.
blockdesc-drying-rack-*-empty-*: Add 4 pieces of Salted Meat, Salted Porkchops or Salted Mutton (Sneak + RMB)

blockdesc-sisalrug-small-ground-*: When placed in a sunny location, dries 16 berries and produces 8 Dried fruit. Use as a label when creating chests.
blockdesc-sisalrug-medium-ground-*: When placed in a sunny location, dries up to 32 berries and produces 16 Dried fruit.
blockdesc-sisalrug-large-ground-*: When placed in a sunny location, dries up to 64 berries and produces 32 Dried fruit. Used to craft the Burden basket.

block-dryingmat-fresh-small-redcurrant-*: Small Drying Mat with Fresh Red Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-small-redcurrant-*: Small Drying Mat with Dry Red Currant
block-dryingmat-fresh-medium-redcurrant-: Medium Drying Mat with Fresh Red Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-medium-redcurrant-*: Medium Drying Mat with Dry Red Currant
block-dryingmat-fresh-large-redcurrant-*: Large Drying Mat with Fresh Red Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-large-redcurrant-*: Large Drying Mat with Dry Red Currant
block-dryingmat-fresh-small-saguaro-*: Small Drying Mat with Fresh Saguaro
block-dryingmat-dry-small-saguaro-*: Small Drying Mat with Dry Saguaro
block-dryingmat-fresh-medium-saguaro-*: Medium Drying Mat with Fresh Saguaro
block-dryingmat-dry-medium-saguaro-*: Medium Drying Mat with Dry Saguaro
block-dryingmat-fresh-large-saguaro-*: Large Drying Mat with Fresh Saguaro
block-dryingmat-dry-large-saguaro-*: Large Drying Mat with Dry Saguaro
block-dryingmat-fresh-small-whitecurrant: Small Drying Mat with Fresh White Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-small-whitecurrant-*: Small Drying Mat with Dry White Currant
block-dryingmat-fresh-medium-whitecurran: Medium Drying Mat with Fresh White Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-medium-whitecurrant-: Medium Drying Mat with Dry White Currant
block-dryingmat-fresh-large-whitecurrant: Large Drying Mat with Fresh White Currant
block-dryingmat-dry-large-whitecurrant-*: Large Drying Mat with Dry White Currant
blockdesc-dryingmat-fresh-*: Will Produce Dry Fruit after 48 hours of direct sunlight.
blockdesc-dryingmat-dry-*: Hold RMB to harvest the Dry Fruit.
blockdesc-panel-bamboo-*: Place on ground (Sneak + RMB) and add materials to construct blocks. Add leather strips to begin Door Assembly,  Very Thin Branches to create a Bamboo Chest Frame, or bamboo stakes to craft bamboo planks. Can be placed on walls or floors for decoration.
blockdesc-panel-*-bark-*: Place on ground or walls for decoration.
blockdesc-panel-*-debarked-*: Place on ground (Sneak + RMB) and add materials to construct blocks.  Add hinges to begin a Wood Door Assembly, or Very Thin Branches to create a Wood Chest Frame. Can be placed on walls or floors for decoration. Place on the ground and use the saw to create half panels.
blockdesc-panel-*-planks-*: Place on ground (Sneak + RMB) and add materials to construct blocks.  Add Very Thin Branches to create a drying tray. Can be placed on walls or floors for decoration. Place on the ground and use the saw to create half panels.
blockdesc-planks-bamboo-*: Crafted from Bamboo panel and 3 stakes
blockdesc-chestframe-bamboo-brown-*: Sneak + RMB with 4 Brown Bamboo Panels to build the Brown Bamboo Chest Assembly
blockdesc-chestframe-bamboo-green-*: Sneak + RMB with 4 Green Bamboo Panels to build the Green Bamboo Chest Assembly
blockdesc-chestframe-*: (Sneak + RMB) with 4 Debarked Wood Panels to build the Chest Assembly
blockdesc-chestsides-bamboo-*: Add 2 leather strips (Sneak + RMB) to make a Latched Bamboo Chest
blockdesc-chestsides-*: Add 2 metal hinges (Sneak + RMB) to create a Latched Wood Chest
blockdesc-chestlatched-*: (Sneak + RMB) with a panel to complete the chest
blockdesc-chestcomplete-*: Add a label using a small sisal rug (Sneak + RMB). Break at this step to collect a chest without a label
blockdesc-labeledchestcomplete-*: Break to collect the Labeled Chest
blockdesc-halflog-*: Hold (Sneak + RMB) with an axe in the active hand to make the Chopping Block
blockdesc-door-assemble-bamboo-brown-*: Add a brown bamboo panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Brown Bamboo Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-bamboo-green-*: Add a green bamboo panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Green Bamboo Door
blockdesc-door-full-bamboo-brown-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Bamboo Door
blockdesc-door-full-bamboo-green-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Bamboo Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-aged-*: Add an Aged Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Aged Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-acacia-*: Add an Acacia Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Acacia Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-birch-*: Add a Birch Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Birch Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-kapok-*: Add a Kapok Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Kapok Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-maple-*: Add a Maple Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Maple Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-oak-*: Add an Oak Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Oak Door
blockdesc-door-assemble-pine-*: Add a Pine Debarked Panel (Sneak + RMB) to complete the Pine Door
blockdesc-door-full-acacia-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Acacia Door
blockdesc-door-full-aged-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Aged Door
blockdesc-door-full-birch-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Birch Door
blockdesc-door-full-kapok-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Kapok Door
blockdesc-door-full-maple-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Maple Door
blockdesc-door-full-oak-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Oak Door
blockdesc-door-full-pine-*: Place, break, and replace to use the Pine Door
blockdesc-logwall-*: Equip any hammer to change block shape and rotation.  To change block shapes: Wall, Jut and Corner, use (Sneak + RMB). To rotate blocks horizontally: use (RMB). To rotate blocks vertically, use (Sprint + RMB).
blockdesc-rooframp-*: To change block style (Ramp to Stairs), equip any axe and use (Sneak + RMB). To change block shape (Slope, Slope Wall, Top, Top Wall, Top End, Corner, Inside Corner, Top Corner), equip any hammer and use (Sneak + RMB). To rotate the block horizontally, use a hammer + RMB or (Sprint + RMB).
blockdesc-roofstairs-*: To change block style (Stairs to Ramp), equip any axe and use (Sneak + RMB). To change block shape (Slope, Slope Wall, Top, Top Wall, Top End, Corner, Inside Corner, Top Corner), equip any hammer and use (Sneak + RMB). To rotate the block horizontally, use a hammer + RMB or (Sprint + RMB).
blockdesc-primitivefence-support-*: An immersion addition used with midsections to create a fence. Requires no metal tools to craft from branches and cordage. Break and replace to change orientation.
blockdesc-primitivefence-midsection-*: Place between primitive fence supports. Requires no metal tools to craft from branches and cordage. Break and replace to change orientation.
blockdesc-primitivegate-*: Place between primitive fence supports. Requires no metal tools to craft from branches and cordage. Break and replace to change orientation.
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-birch: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-oak: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-maple: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-pine: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-acacia: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-leavesbranchy-*-kapok: Must use an axe to break
blockdesc-dead-chicken-*: Butcher with any knife to harvest feathers, poultry meat, and possibly some fat.
blockdesc-dead-hare-*: Butcher using any knife to harvest hare meat and sometimes a pelt or hide.
blockdesc-dead-armadillo-*: Butcher using any knife to harvest red meat.
blockdesc-dead-raccoon-*: Butcher using any knife to harvest carnivore meat, small bones and raw hide.
blockdesc-dead-fox-*: Butcher using any knife to harvest carnivore meat, and sometimes a pelt or hide.
blockdesc-dead-wild-sheep-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest mutton, tendons, fat, bones and intestines. Rams may also provide horns. Use an axe, saw, or sword before skinning to try to collect a Head Trophy. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-dead-sheep-domestic-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest mutton, tendons, fat, bones and intestines. Rams may also provide horns. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-dead-pig-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest pork chops, tendons, fat, bones and intestines. Use an axe, saw, or sword before skinning to try to collect a Head Trophy. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-dead-pig-domestic-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest pork chops, tendons, fat, bones and intestines.
blockdesc-dead-wolf-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest carnivore meat, tendons, fat, bones. Use an axe, saw, or sword before skinning to try to collect a Head Trophy. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-dead-hyena-*: Skin the animal using any knife to harvest raw hides. Butcher to harvest carnivore meat, tendons, fat, bones. Use an axe, saw, or sword before skinning to try to collect a Head Trophy. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-dead-rotten-*: Carrion cannot be destroyed and will decay into a skeleton.
blockdesc-skeleton-small: Use RMB to pick up, or use any axe to harvest small bones
blockdesc-skeleton-large: Use RMB to pick up, or use any axe to harvest 4 large bones
blockdesc-headless-*: Skin using any knife to harvest raw hides. Headless animals sometimes provide pelts instead of hides.
blockdesc-skinned-*: Butcher to harvest meat, fat, bones and other useful materials. Sometimes skinned animals provide a skull trophy.
blockdesc-skinnedheadless-*: Butcher to harvest meat, fat, bones, and other useful materials.
blockdesc-bighornpelt-ground-*: Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to create a Rug + 4 leather strips.
blockdesc-bighornrug-ground-*: Rugs can be placed on floors or walls. Use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to 4 large raw hides.
blockdesk-boarpelt-ground-*: Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to create a Rug + 4 leather strips.
blockdesk-boarrug-ground-*: Rugs can be placed on floors or walls. Use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to 4 medium raw hides.
blockdesc-foxpelt-*: This pelt is too small to craft a rug, but can be placed on floors or walls. Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to 3 small raw hide.
blockdesc-harepelt-*: This pelt is too small to craft a rug, but can be placed on floors or walls. Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to 1 small raw hide.
blockdesc-wolfpelt-*-*-*: Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to create a Rug + 4 leather strips.
blockdesc-wolfrug-*-*-*: Rugs can be placed on floors or walls. Place the rug on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to to 3 medium raw hides.
blockdesc-hyenapelt-*: Place the pelt on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to create a Rug + 4 leather strips.
blockdesc-hyenarug-*: Rugs can be placed on floors or walls. Place the rug on the ground and use a knife (Sneak + HOLD RMB) to convert to 3 medium raw hides.
blockdesc-crackedbrick-*: Immersion addition. Crafted from a brick block and a hammer.
blockdesc-crackedrock-*: Immersion addition. Crafted from relieved stone and a hammer.
blockdesc-crackedrockpolished-*: Immersion addition. Crafted from a polished stone block and a hammer.
itemdesc-settinghammer-*: Use on stepping stones to convert to paved road blocks
itemdesc-tamper-*: Use on placed small stones to convert to stepping stones.
blockdesc-3droad-*: Place any type of small stone and use the tamper to create stepping stones. Use the setting hammer on stepping stones to create the paved road blocks.
blockdesc-jar-*: These are decorative ONLY. Storage function is not yet implemented.
